title: [Large-Scale] Macau Tourism Retail and Marketing Management Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic marketing theory and retail operations processes
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education based on experiential learning theory and Bloomâ€™s taxonomy, conducted in a microlearning environment utilizing digital devices, with competency achievement measured through summative assessment.

learning_goals: Learners analyze three types of customer needs through practice-based simulations (role-play, VR scenarios) within a week, propose at least two customized sales strategies based on the analysis, and achieve 3.5 or higher on a 5-point rubric.

Learners analyze three target customer segments using digital marketing tools (Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager), create customized promotion plans for each segment, and select/design one executable promotion within a 500,000 KRW budget.

Learners analyze five cross-cultural communication scenarios in global retail environments (e.g., Middle Eastern/Asian customers) during three team-based simulations within a week, propose three response strategies reflecting cultural differences, and achieve an average of 4.0 or higher on peer and instructor rubrics (5-point scale).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
